meanings.definition: Make a series of high-pitched sounds, like a bird.
meanings.sent1: The baby birds were cheeping loudly in the nest.
meanings.sent2: The sparrows outside my window were cheeping happily.
meanings.sent3: The cheeping of the chicks made the farmer smile.
meanings.sent4: The cheeping of the birds filled the air with music.
meanings.sent5: I woke up to the cheeping of the early birds outside.

meanings.definition: The act of making high-pitched sounds, like a bird.
meanings.sent1: The constant cheeping of the chicks was adorable.
meanings.sent2: The cheeping of the baby robins was a sweet melody.
meanings.sent3: The cheeping of the chicks sounded like a tiny choir.
meanings.sent4: The cheeping of the birds echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The cheeping of the nestlings was a sign of new life.
